solution_line_template: Nathan harvested a total of {strawberry_plants} x {strawberries_per_plant} = <<{strawberry_plants}*{strawberries_per_plant}={total_strawberries}>>{total_strawberries} strawberries
He harvested a total of {tomato_plants} x {tomatoes_per_plant} = <<{tomato_plants}*{tomatoes_per_plant}={total_tomatoes}>>{total_tomatoes} tomatoes.
He was able to fill {total_strawberries}/{basket_capacity} = <<{total_strawberries}/{basket_capacity}={strawberry_baskets}>>{strawberry_baskets} baskets with strawberries.
He was able to fill {total_tomatoes}/{basket_capacity} = <<{total_tomatoes}/{basket_capacity}={tomato_baskets}>>{tomato_baskets} baskets with tomatoes.
He made {strawberry_baskets} x ${strawberry_basket_price} = $<<{strawberry_baskets}*{strawberry_basket_price}={money_from_strawberries}>>{money_from_strawberries} from the strawberries.
He made {tomato_baskets} x $ {tomato_basket_price} = $<<{tomato_baskets}*{tomato_basket_price}={money_from_tomatoes}>>{money_from_tomatoes} from the tomatoes.
All together, he made ${money_from_strawberries} + ${money_from_tomatoes} = $<<{money_from_strawberries}+{money_from_tomatoes}={total_money}>>{total_money} from his harvest.
